pr_title: Add more operational metrics for metrics processing

timeline.bodyText: Can we make this logic into a util method that both metricsdbTarFilter and metricsdbFilter can use?
timeline.author: sruti1312

replies.bodyText: I don't think that'll work well since we want the logic to produce two variables (sizeUncompressedMetricsdbFiles and numUncompressedMetricsdbFiles). Also, the duplication here doesn't seem like too much to require factoring out the logic.
replies.author: ricardolstephen

timeline.bodyText: Instead of creating a new file and getting its length, can we replace new File(metricsDB.getDBFilePath()).length() with metricsDB.getDBFilePath().length()?
timeline.author: khushbr

replies.bodyText: I don't think that would work. getDBFilePath actually returns a String, not a Path. Also, a Path doesn't have a method to retrieve the size of the underlying file.
replies.author: ricardolstephen

timeline.bodyText:
Please add a comment here stating what this regex represents.
Also, we should add UT here for checking this regex behavior.
timeline.author: khushbr

replies.bodyText: Verified the correct behavior of the regex manually. The ut's can be a little more ticky for this due to the use of private variables and static methods. Will raise another separate issue to add these uts #538.
replies.author: ricardolstephen

timeline.bodyText: Instead of performing a FileSystems.getDefault().getPathMatcher(metricsdbPattern);, can use a config to define the location of these files ?  We are performing something similar here : https://github.com/opendistro-for-elasticsearch/performance-analyzer-rca/blob/master/src/main/java/com/amazon/opendistro/elasticsearch/performanceanalyzer/metricsdb/MetricsDB.java#L351
timeline.author: khushbr

replies.bodyText: Not completely sure what you mean by "config" here. There currently a configurable prefix (an absolute path prefix) for these metricsdb files. We probably don't want to split this prefix into a directory and filename prefix if that's what you mean -- doesn't seem too compelling to take on this new addition just for these two uses at the moment.
replies.author: ricardolstephen

replies.bodyText:
I refer to using a variable like DB_FILE_PREFIX_PATH_CONF_NAME as used here and my concern was regarding the  FileSystems.getDefault().getPathMatcher(metricsdbPattern);. I see that you have addressed this in the latest code revision.
String prefix = PluginSettings.instance().getSettingValue(DB_FILE_PREFIX_PATH_CONF_NAME, DB_FILE_PREFIX_PATH_DEFAULT);
replies.author: khushbr

 import com.amazon.opendistro.elasticsearch.performanceanalyzer.AppContext;

timeline.bodyText: Can we avoid the nested try-catch blocks here? Let's move both the DirectoryStream  object creation to one 'try-catch' and then have inner 'try-catch' as now. Also, update the variable name from stream to metricsdbStream and metricsdbTarStream resp.
timeline.author: khushbr

replies.bodyText: Not a huge fan of removing the nested try-catch -- I don't want issues with one or two files corrupting the whole sampling. But yes, will make the other changes.
replies.author: ricardolstephen

replies.bodyText:
I still dont understand why we have nested try-catch here.  Nested try-catch should be used in case the catch or finally block throws an exception. We have only Log statements in catch block here.
There should be Unit Tests and Integrations Tests written to check for all failure scenarios, nested try-catch is hardly the way.
replies.author: khushbr

replies.bodyText: Going to change this to use a blanket try-catch and simply return without sampling if any issues are found (say, if the stream contains a Path whose associated file is deleted in the middle of sampling).
replies.author: ricardolstephen

timeline.bodyText: Will this error log overwhelm the log file in any case? Can we somehow reduce the frequency, maybe club all the failures and put a single log message?
timeline.author: khushbr

replies.bodyText: Sure, will try something like that.
replies.author: ricardolstephen
